definition: to make up the number (i.e. to fill places up to a given number)/to serve as stopgap
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group

sentences.english: Martin recollected his blank-verse tragedy, and sent it instead.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁想起了他的素體詩悲劇，便把它寄去充數。
他是個濫竽充數的演員。

sentences.english: But I could not read the menu and survived on a junk food diet instead.
sentences.chinese: 可是因爲我看不懂菜單，所以就買了些垃圾食物充數。

sentences.english: Four 12)raggedy excuses planted by the city.
sentences.chinese: 市政栽下充數的四棵殘次品。

sentences.english: You can also hear people saying it about themselves to show their modesty.
sentences.chinese: 人們有時也用“濫竽充數”來表示自謙。

sentences.english: Four raggedy excuses planted by the city.
sentences.chinese: 市政栽下充數的四棵殘次品。

sentences.english: He is a poor apology for an actor.
sentences.chinese: 他是個濫竽充數的演員。

sentences.english: Am I just making up numbers?
Are you just making up numbers?
He is a poor apology for a researcher of the American drama.
sentences.chinese: 他不過是一名濫竽充數的美國戲劇研究者。
